item.description: During an interview this week I’ve been asked “what is the difference between Functional, Object-Oriented and Procedural Programming” and to be honest I did not really know how to answer to that question (and it was the first time I was hearing about Procedural Programming…).

item.description: ТЕКСТ: Маша Будрите ОТВЕТЫ НА БОЛЬШИНСТВО ВОЛНУЮЩИХ НАС ВОПРОСОВ мы все привыкли искать онлайн. В этой серии материалов задаём именно такие вопросы — животрепещущие, неожиданные или распространённые — профессионалам в самых разных сферах.

How Linux Signals Work - SIGINT, SIGTERM and SIGKILL
item.description: original Software interrupts on Linux and Unix systems are made via signals. There are many different Linux signals, but a few stand out and are important to understand and know: SIGINT, SIGTERM, and SIGKILL.
